intro: Dendrostylis echinata, commonly known as the spiny dendrostylis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and showy, woolly leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
